title: What are the limitations to the practice of human rights? - Quora

response.answer_text: No person’s right to do anything can trump another person’s right to do something else. If two rights seem to be in conflict one of them is not a right in the situation. No one can exercise a right the harms anyone else who did not initiate force or fraud. In general, however, there is no limitations on the practice of human rights. The issue is when one person’s rights are superior to another person’s.
